content.description: <math alttext="H B r O aqueous plus H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium with H 3 O with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus B r O with a negative 1 charge aqueous; K sub e q equals 2.8 times 10 to the negative 9 power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HBrO</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>3</mtext></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>BrO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The equilibrium reaction in <math alttext="0.100 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="H B r O aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HBrO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equation above. Based on the magnitude of the equilibrium constant, which of the following correctly compares the equilibrium concentrations of substances involved in the reaction, and why?

choices.label: The equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="B r O with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>BrO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> will be much smaller than the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="H 3 O with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is the solvent and is present in the largest amount.

The equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="B r O with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>BrO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> will be much smaller than the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="H B r O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HBrO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="K sub e q is significantly less than 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="H 3 O with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>3</mtext></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> will be much smaller than the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="B r O with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>BrO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because all the <math alttext="H B r O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>HBrO</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> will react to produce <math alttext="B r O with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>BrO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="H 3 O with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>3</mtext></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> will be much larger than the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="H B r O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>HBrO</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="K sub e q is significantly less than 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="B r O with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>BrO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> will be much smaller than the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="H B r O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HBrO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="K sub e q is significantly less than 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
